pros: Flexibility with hours, low-stress job
cons: Supervisors NEVER had anything positive to say to you. The only time that feedback was given was when it was negative. The culture rewarded apathy, complacency, and laziness. "Just forward it to another department" was a common theme. The gossip was intolerable, and frankly--pathetic. The adult staff behaved like children, gossiping and spreading rumors about people in the office that did not fit the ESU mold. It is sad, really, how childish these people behave. If you are low-achieving, irrational, and/or have nothing better to do than to talk about other people, then this place is for you.

pros: You will have steady work. The i worked alone as a photographer, but i loved it. You work under someone, but you don't always have to report in. If they have questions they ask, otherwise you can be confident that you are doing good work.
cons: The hours vary. If you have an event to shoot late at night, you will be the only on in the office as you upload the photos. this could be a pro for people who prefer to work when no one else is around.

review_title: Great opportunity for those seeking a MS in Math!
job_title: Mathematics Teaching Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: The tuition waiver was a life-saver. If you're not sure if you want to pursue a PhD in Math, the MS in Math program will let you know if you're up to the task. Furthermore, practically all classes you need for the MS in Math program can be taken online.
cons: The stipend you get as a TA is significantly lower than other places like WSU, KSU, or KU. If you're an older person with family, the stipend won't help you very much. However, this probably is to be expected from a public college that typically has lower enrollment compared to other public colleges in Kansas.

job_title: Human Resource Student Assistant in Emporia, KS
pros: The people are nice and knowledgeable in the job.  Also willing to help students learn how to do the job.The staff work around the students class schedule so each student has the opportunity to learn.
cons: I worked as a student so there were no cons to the job.  The staff work around the students class schedule so each student has the opportunity to learn.

pros: Work compensation for the student position I worked in was at least minimum wage and for the most part the persons I worked along with were easy to get along with. It was easy to get time off from work when necessary.
cons: One of the supervisors I worked with enjoyed micromanaging. This was extremely frustrating and led to there being some frustration in the work environment.

review_title: Graduate Assistant in the MBA program
pros: Position pays for the school and offers a small salary on top.  Easy to get into the MBA program and there is an ERP (enterprise resource planning) concentration.
cons: Some teachers are very nit-picky and assign work that isn't all that useful for a professional career.  There are lots of foreign exchange students in the MBA program and language barriers cause problems in communication.

review_title: Not a bad gig, if you have the right boss

Work-school balance (only 20 hours per week)
Get to know faculty

cons:
Low man on the totem pole (don't expect a lot of respect)

review_title: Well-meaning people lost in a time warp

Friendly people who embrace others who look and act like them.
Never is heard a discouraging word
Very easy to get around in town
Inexpensive housing

Cut down tall poppies - anyone with visible success is suspect.

cons: Graduate teaching assistants are given very little training in the field of teaching, so inexperienced instructors often felt a little lost.
